intro: Masdevallia ecaudata, commonly known as the "Horned Masdevallia," is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of South America. It is characterized by its unique, elongated pseudobulbs and its striking, often brightly colored flowers that resemble horns. The plant typically grows epiphytically on trees, relying on air moisture and organic debris for nutrients. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain water in its humid, high-altitude habitat. Masdevallia ecaudata is valued by orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental beauty and relatively compact growth habit.
